title: WATCH: A debate over ballot Question 4, which could repeal Mass. undocumented immigrant driver's license law
dc:creator: WBUR
description: Question 4 deals with an existing law that allows immigrants in Massachusetts who do not have legal status to obtain a driver's license. A "yes" vote would keep the law on the books. A "no" vote would repeal the law.
itunes:author: WBUR
itunes:title: WATCH: A debate over ballot Question 4, which could repeal Mass. undocumented immigrant driver's license law
itunes:summary: Question 4 deals with an existing law that allows immigrants in Massachusetts who do not have legal status to obtain a driver's license. A "yes" vote would keep the law on the books. A "no" vote would repeal the law.
itunes:subtitle: Question 4 deals with an existing law that allows immigrants in Massachusetts who do not have legal status to obtain a driver's license. A "yes" vote would keep the law on the books. A "no" vote would repeal the law.

media:content.media:description: People sign a banner during a rally in front of the State House in Boston on June 9 held in support of allowing immigrants in the country illegally to obtain driver's licenses in Massachusetts. (Steven Senne/AP)

content:encoded: Question 4 deals with an existing law that allows immigrants in Massachusetts who do not have legal status to obtain a driver's license. A "yes" vote would keep the law on the books. A "no" vote would repeal the law.
